ivardefs.name: code
ivardefs.desc: A code - a text symbol - that uniquely identifies the concept within the code system.

ivardefs.name: definition
ivardefs.desc: The formal definition of the concept. The code system resource does not make formal definitions required, because of the prevalence of legacy systems. However, they are highly recommended, as without them there is no formal meaning associated with the con

ivardefs.name: designation_
ivardefs.desc: Additional representations for the concept - other languages, aliases, specialized purposes, used for particular purposes, etc.

ivardefs.name: display
ivardefs.desc: A human readable string that is the recommended default way to present this concept to a user.

ivardefs.name: property_
ivardefs.desc: A property value for this concept.

properties.desc: Concepts that are in the code system. The concept definitions are inherently hierarchical, but the definitions must be consulted to determine what the meaning of the hierarchical relationships are.
